dhp33:1: The mind is wobbly and shaky,
dhp33:2: hard to guard, hard to curb.
dhp33:3: A smart guy straightens it up,
dhp34:1: Like a fish cast on the shore,
dhp34:3: you should give up this wobbly mind,
dhp35:3: it's good to tame the mind,
dhp35:4: a tamed mind leads to bliss.
dhp36:1: So very hard to see, so tiny,
dhp36:3: a smart guy guards the mind,
dhp36:4: a guarded mind leads to bliss.
dhp37:4: is freed from the bonds of Māra.
dhp38:1: For those whose mind is not steady,
dhp38:2: who don’t understand the true teaching,
dhp39:1: For those whose mind is not drowned,
dhp39:3: who have given up good and bad,
dhp39:4: those wakeful ones have nothing to fear.
dhp40:1: Knowing this body breaks like a pot,
dhp40:2: and building the mind like a fortress,
dhp40:3: attack Māra with the sword of wisdom,
dhp41:2: will be laid down on the earth,
dhp42:2: or enemies in any direction at all,
dhp42:4: and they forge evil out of that.
dhp43:1: They do not forge mother or father,
dhp43:4: and they forge improvement out of that.
